intro: Heptapleurum multinervium, commonly known as the veiny laurel, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have prominent veins, contributing to its common name. Heptapleurum multinervium is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in horticulture for its aesthetic appeal.
